channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Their house was purchased with my family money’: My late father left a life estate to his second wife. She’s only 10 years older than me. How can I undo this?
item.description: “Apparently the probate laws in Florida are different, perhaps superseding the will.”

item.title: How Long Can the U.S. Economy's 'Goldilocks' Moment Last?
item.description: Markets seem pleased with a strong jobs reading, but significant risks remain.

item.title: A Tried-and-True Investing Pattern Has Lost Its Shape
item.description: Deciding what sectors and companies are cyclical versus defensive has suddenly got a lot more complicated.

item.title: One Small-Stock Fund Crashes the Big-Tech Party
item.description: Hood River fund places No. 6, the outlier among the large-cap funds whose heady gains have been driven by the ‘Magnificent Seven.’

item.title: ‘He’s 70 and fairly wealthy’: I met the love of my life three years ago. How do I politely ask that he include me in his will?
item.description: “His two sons are against any kind of commitment between us, as their dad has had two failed marriages.”

item.title: ‘I feel like I’m missing something’: I’m 68, divorced with two children. I’ve $750,000 and rent my home. Do I need a trust?
item.description: “I continue to reinvest the dividends and interest so my investments continue to grow.”

item.title: ‘I’m scared to death’: My wife asked for a divorce after 21 years. She wants to buy a house with our savings, but promises to help pay my mortgage.
item.description: “There is more than enough money in the savings to completely pay off the current mortgage.”

item.title: Corporate Insiders Are Sitting Out the 2024 Stock-Market Rally
item.description: Warren Buffett, Jamie Dimon and Jeff Bezos are among the business leaders exhibiting caution.

item.title: The Financial Wreckage of Hurricanes: Delayed Retirements, Deep Debt
item.description: Storms need only minutes to devastate people’s finances. Even residents with decent insurance and government support need years to recover.

item.title: ‘We didn’t sign an exclusive listing’: A realtor said she’d take out an ad to rent my New York City apartment. Am I morally obligated to use her?
item.description: “Other agents know our apartment is available for rent and now want to show it.”
